00070 static u32* msgbuf_in_physaddr  = ((u32 *) na_MSGiBuffer_base);
00071 static u32* msgbuf_out_physaddr = ((u32 *) na_MSGoBuffer_base);
00072 static u32* regfile_physaddr    = ((u32 *) na_RegFile_base);
00073 static int dcsc_msgbuf_in_size   = na_MSGiBuffer_size;
00074 static int dcsc_msgbuf_out_size  = na_MSGoBuffer_size;
00075 static int dcsc_regfile_size     = na_RegFile_size;
00076 #else //INCLUDE_EXCALIBUR_H
00077 // the default values can be changed at driver load time

00079 static int dcsc_msgbuf_out_size  = 0x400;
00080 static int dcsc_regfile_size     = 0x10;
00081 static u32* msgbuf_in_physaddr  = ((u32 *) 0x80000400);
00082 static u32* msgbuf_out_physaddr = ((u32 *) 0x80000800);
00083 static u32* regfile_physaddr    = ((u32 *) 0x80000060);
00084 #endif //INCLUDE_EXCALIBUR_H

00101 module_param(msgbuf_in_physaddr, uint, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR);  // physical address of the MIB in FPGA firmware
00102 module_param(msgbuf_out_physaddr, uint, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR); // physical address of the MRB in FPGA firmware

00114 /*
00115  * access modes not yet used
00116  * in ACCESS_ALL mode the driver is forseen to export the 3 buffers sequentially after each other
00117  * MIB -> MRB -> REG
00118  * other modes are intended to support separated access via different minor driver numbers
00119  */
00120 static int iAccessMode=ACCESS_ALL;

00126 /**************************************************************************************************
00127  * some helper functions to check the address space
00128  */
00129 // very basic MEMTEST
00130 // size in u8, test in u32
00131 static int memtest(u32 begin, u32 size) {
00132   u32 i,rd;
00133   int ret=0;
00134   int success=0;
00135   for (i=0;i<size;i+=4) {
00136     writel(i+1, begin + i);
00137   }
00138 
00139   for (i=0;i<size;i+=4) {
00140     rd=readl(begin + i);
00141     if (  rd != i+1 ) {
00142       //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "Read fail @ 0x%08X: read 0x%08X, expected 0x%08X",begin+i,rd,i);
00143       ret++;
00144     } else {
00145       success++;
00146       //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Read succeeded @ 0x%08X: read 0x%08X, expected 0x%08X",begin+i,rd,i+1);
00147     }
00148   }
00149   //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG " %d read cycles succeeded", success);
00150   return ret;
00151 }
00152 
00153 static int dcs_comparevalue(u32 begin, u32 size, u32 value) {
00154   u32 i,rd;
00155   int ret=0;
00156   for (i=0;i<size;i+=4) {
00157     rd=readl(begin + i);
00158     if (rd != value ) {
00159       //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING " compare failed @ 0x%08X: read 0x%08X, expected 0x%08X",begin+i,rd,value);
00160       ret++;
00161     } else {
00162       //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_DBG, KERN_INFO " compare succeeded @ 0x%08X: read 0x%08X, expected 0x%08X",begin+i,rd,value);
00163     }
00164   }
00165   return ret;
00166 }
00167 
00168 static int dcs_writevalue (u32 begin, u32 size, u32 value) {
00169    int i;
00170    u32 offs=0;
00171    for (i=0;i<size;i+=4){
00172      writel(value,begin+i);
00173      offs++;
00174    }
00175    return 0;
00176 }
00177 
00178 /**************************************************************************************************
00179  * basic internal functions
00180  */
00181 
00182 /* read from memory
00183  * the readl and readb functions are provided by the system and must be used to read from 
00184  * io memory initialized by ioremap (see init_module)
00185  * parameters:
00186  *  begin: start address
00187  *  size:  size of the buffer in BYTE
00188  *  buff:  pointer to buffer that receives data
00189  */
00190 static int dcs_read (u32 begin, u32 size, u32* buff) 
00191 {
00192   int i;
00193   u32 wordoffs=0;
00194   u32 byteoffs=0; 
00195   for (i=0;i<size/4;i++){ // do the multiples of 4 
00196     *(buff+wordoffs) = readl(begin+i*4);
00197     wordoffs++;    
00198   }
00199   i*=4;
00200   for (;i<size;i++) { // do the remaining bytes
00201     *(((char*)(buff+wordoffs))+byteoffs)=readb(begin+i);
00202     byteoffs++;
00203   }
00204   return 0;
00205 }
00206 
00207 /* write to memory
00208  * the writel and writeb functions are provided by the system and must be used to write to 
00209  * io memory initialized by ioremap (see init_module)
00210  * parameters:
00211  *  begin: start address
00212  *  size:  size of the buffer in BYTE
00213  *  buff:  pointer to buffer to write
00214  */
00215 static int dcs_write (u32 begin, u32 size, u32* buff) 
00216 {
00217   int i;
00218   u32 wordoffs=0;
00219   u32 byteoffs=0; 
00220 
00221   for (i=0;i<size/4;i++){// do the multibles of 4
00222     writel(*(buff+wordoffs),begin+i*4);
00223     wordoffs++;
00224   }
00225   i*=4;
00226   for (;i<size;i++) { // do the remaining bytes
00227     writeb(*(((char*)(buff+wordoffs))+byteoffs), begin+i);
00228     byteoffs++;
00229   }
00230   return 0;
00231 }
00232 
00233 /* find the buffer for the access region 
00234 the access region appears to the user as a solid block containing the write buffer of dcsc_msgbuf_in_size bytes, 
00235 followed by the read message buffer of dcsc_msgbuf_out_size and the register buffer of dcsc_regfile_size bytes
00236 parameter: size of the buffer, <0 in case of an error
00237  offset       - position in the access region
00238  iAccessMode  - access mode, see defines
00239 return: 
00240  ppBuffer     - receives pointer to buffer
00241  pPosition    - receives position in the buffer
00242  ppBufferName - receives string describing the buffer
00243  */
00244 u32 findBufferForAddress(loff_t offset, int iAccessMode,  u32** ppBuffer, u32* pPosition, const char** ppBufferName)
00245 {
00246   u32 u32Size=0, u32Pos=0;
00247   u32* pu32Buffer=NULL;
00248   const char* pBufferName="";
00249   if (offset < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size) {
00250     if (iAccessMode&ACCESS_IN_BUFFER /*|| iAccessMode==ACCESS_REGIONS*/) {
00251       u32Pos=offset;
00252       pu32Buffer=msgbuf_in_virtbase;
00253       u32Size=dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00254       pBufferName="write msg buffer";
00255     } else {
00256       //mrlogmessage(LOG_FLAG_ALL, KERN_WARNING "");
00257       u32Size=-EFAULT;
00258     }
00259   } else if (offset >= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size && offset < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size+dcsc_msgbuf_out_size) {
00260     if (iAccessMode&ACCESS_OUT_BUFFER /*|| iAccessMode==ACCESS_REGIONS*/) {
00261       u32Pos=offset-dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00262       pu32Buffer=msgbuf_out_virtbase;
00263       u32Size=dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00264       pBufferName="read msg buffer";
00265     } else {
00266       //mrlogmessage(LOG_FLAG_ALL, KERN_WARNING "");
00267       u32Size=-EFAULT;
00268     }
00269   } else if (offset >= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size + dcsc_msgbuf_out_size && offset < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size + dcsc_msgbuf_out_size + dcsc_regfile_size) {
00270     if (iAccessMode&ACCESS_REGFILE /*|| iAccessMode==ACCESS_REGIONS*/) {
00271       u32Pos=offset - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size - dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00272       pu32Buffer=regfile_virtbase;
00273       u32Size=dcsc_regfile_size;
00274       pBufferName="register buffer";
00275     } else {
00276       //mrlogmessage(LOG_FLAG_ALL, KERN_WARNING "");
00277       u32Size=-EFAULT;
00278     }
00279   } else
00280     u32Size=-ESPIPE;
00281   if (u32Size>=0) {
00282     if (u32Size<=u32Pos)
00283       u32Size-=u32Pos;
00284     else
00285       mrlogmessage(LOG_FLAG_ALL, KERN_ERR "buffer position exceeds buffer size");
00286     if (ppBuffer) *ppBuffer=pu32Buffer;
00287     if (pPosition) *pPosition=u32Pos;
00288     else if (ppBuffer) mrlogmessage(LOG_FLAG_ALL, KERN_WARNING "return variable missing for position in buffer, check your call");
00289     if (ppBufferName) *ppBufferName=pBufferName;
00290   }
00291   return u32Size;
00292 }
00293 
00294 /******************************************************************************************************
00295  * driver lock
00296  */
00297 
00298 /* global variables
00299  */
00300 wait_queue_head_t g_waitQueue;  // the wait queue for the concurrenting processes
00301 int g_iLockReset=0;             // an emergency back door, all released processes terminate lockDriver()
00302 int g_iLock=0;                  // the lock itself
00303 int g_iLockPid=0;               // the pid of the locking process
00304 int g_iSeizeCode=0;            // the master lock code
00305 spinlock_t g_spinlock;
00306 int g_iLockInitialized=0;
00307 
00308 int InitDriverLock(void)
00309 {
00310   int iResult=0;
00311   init_waitqueue_head(&g_waitQueue);
00312   spin_lock_init(&g_spinlock);
00313   g_iLockReset=0;
00314   g_iLock=0;
00315   g_iLockPid=0;
00316   g_iSeizeCode=0;
00317   g_iLockInitialized=1;
00318   return iResult;
00319 }
00320 
00321 int lockActivate(void)
00322 {
00323   int iResult=0;
00324   g_iLockReset=0;
00325   return iResult;
00326 }
00327 
00328 int lockReset(void)
00329 {
00330   int iResult=0;
00331   g_iLockReset=1; // set the flag so that the processes do not try to lock again
00332   g_iLock=0;
00333   g_iLockPid=0;
00334   g_iSeizeCode=0;
00335   if (g_iLockInitialized) {
00336     wake_up(&g_waitQueue); // wake up all processes
00337   }
00338   return iResult;
00339 }
00340 
00353 int checkAndLock(int iSeizeCode, int pid)
00354 {
00355   int iResult=0;
00356   if (g_iLockInitialized) {
00357     //mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "checkAndLock: process %d, iSeizeCode %d, g_iSeizeCode %d", pid, iSeizeCode, g_iSeizeCode);    
00358     spin_lock(&g_spinlock);
00359     if (g_iSeizeCode>0 && g_iSeizeCode!=iSeizeCode) {
00360       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "checkAndLock: driver seized by other application");    
00361       iResult=-EPERM;
00362     } else if ((iResult=(g_iLock==0))) {
00363       g_iLock++;
00364       g_iLockPid=pid;
00365     } else if ((iResult=(g_iLockPid==pid))) {
00366       g_iLock++;
00367     }
00368     spin_unlock(&g_spinlock);
00369   }
00370   return iResult;
00371 }
00372 
00382 int lockDriver(int iSeizeCode, int iTimeOut)
00383 {
00384   int iResult=0;
00385   if (g_iLockInitialized) {
00386     int iPid=0;
00387     if (current) iPid=current->pid;
00388     while (g_iLockReset==0 && (iResult=checkAndLock(iSeizeCode, iPid))==0) {
00389       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "lockDriver: process %d, timeout %d put to sleep", iPid, iTimeOut);
00390       interruptible_sleep_on(&g_waitQueue);
00391       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "lockDriver: process %d woken up", iPid);
00392     }
00393     if (iResult>=0) {
00394       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "lockDriver: process %d", iPid);
00395     }
00396   }
00397   return iResult;
00398 }
00399 
00403 int unlockDriver(void)
00404 {
00405   int iResult=0;
00406   if (g_iLockInitialized) {
00407     int iPid=0;
00408     if (current) iPid=current->pid;
00409     mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "unlockDriver: process %d", iPid);
00410     spin_lock(&g_spinlock);
00411     if (g_iLockPid==iPid) {
00412       if ((--g_iLock)==0) {
00413     g_iLockPid=0;
00414     wake_up(&g_waitQueue); // wake up all processes
00415       } else if (g_iLock<0) {
00416     g_iLock=0;
00417     mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "underflow while unlocking for process %d", iPid);
00418       }
00419     } else {
00420       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "process %d has no lock on driver", iPid);
00421       iResult=-ENOLCK;
00422     }
00423     spin_unlock(&g_spinlock);
00424   }
00425   return iResult;
00426 }
00427 
00436 int seizeDriver(int iSeizeCode)
00437 {
00438   int iResult=0;
00439   if ((iResult=lockDriver(iSeizeCode, 0))>=0) {
00440     if (g_iSeizeCode==0) {
00441       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "driver seized by process %d", current->pid);
00442       g_iSeizeCode=iSeizeCode;
00443     } else if (g_iSeizeCode==iSeizeCode) {
00444       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "driver already seized by application %d", current->pid);
00445     } else {
00446       // we should never get here
00447       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "driver already seized by another application", current->pid);
00448     }
00449     unlockDriver();
00450   }
00451   return iResult;
00452 }
00453 
00454 
00455 
00462 int releaseDriver(int iSeizeCode)
00463 {
00464   int iResult=0;
00465   if ((iResult=lockDriver(iSeizeCode, 0))>=0) {
00466     if (g_iSeizeCode==0) {
00467       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "driver not seized by process %d", current->pid);
00468       iResult=-ENOLCK;
00469     } else if (g_iSeizeCode==iSeizeCode) {
00470       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "seized driver released by application %d", current->pid);
00471       g_iSeizeCode=0;
00472     } else {
00473       // we should never get here
00474       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "driver is seized by another application", current->pid);
00475     }
00476     unlockDriver();
00477   }
00478   return iResult;
00479 }

00483  */

00485 /*
00486  * method prototypes see below for implementations
00487  */
00488 static loff_t dcsc_llseek(struct file* filp, loff_t off, int ref);
00489 static int dcsc_read(struct file* filp, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos);
00490 static int dcsc_write(struct file* filp, const char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos);
00491 static int dcsc_open(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp);
00492 static int dcsc_close(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp);
00493 static int dcsc_mmap(struct file *filp, struct vm_area_struct *vma);
00494 static int dcsc_ioctl(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg);
00495 
00496 /*
00497  * file_operation structure to define the methods for the char device
00498  * the methods are going to be called from the system
00499  * pointers to the methods are provided at driver initialization via the file_operations structure
00500  */
00501 struct file_operations dcsc_fops = {
00502   llseek:  dcsc_llseek,
00503   read:    dcsc_read,
00504   write:   dcsc_write,
00505   ioctl:   dcsc_ioctl,
00506   mmap:    dcsc_mmap,
00507   open:    dcsc_open,
00508   release: dcsc_close,
00509 };
00510 
00511 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00512 /*
00513  * cleanup of the buffers for the real driver
00514  */
00515 void cleanupRealBuffers(void)
00516 {
00517   if (regfile_virtbase) iounmap((void *)regfile_virtbase);
00518   if (msgbuf_out_virtbase) iounmap((void *)msgbuf_out_virtbase);
00519   if (msgbuf_in_virtbase) iounmap((void *)msgbuf_in_virtbase);
00520 }
00521 
00522 /*
00523  * initialization of the buffers for the real driver
00524  */
00525 #define TEST_PATTERN 0x13071972
00526 int initRealBuffers(void)
00527 {
00528   int iResult=0;
00529   int iNofErr=0;
00530   if (dcsc_msgbuf_in_size>0) {
00531     msgbuf_in_virtbase  = (u32*) ioremap_nocache((u32)msgbuf_in_physaddr,dcsc_msgbuf_in_size);
00532     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Remapped MSGBUF_IN from 0x%p to 0x%p",msgbuf_in_physaddr, msgbuf_in_virtbase);
00533   }
00534   if (dcsc_msgbuf_out_size>0) {
00535     msgbuf_out_virtbase = (u32*) ioremap_nocache((u32)msgbuf_out_physaddr,dcsc_msgbuf_out_size);
00536     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Remapped MSGBUF_OUT from 0x%p to 0x%p",msgbuf_out_physaddr, msgbuf_out_virtbase);
00537   }
00538   if (dcsc_regfile_size) {
00539     regfile_virtbase    = (u32*) ioremap_nocache((u32)regfile_physaddr,dcsc_regfile_size);
00540     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Remapped REGFILE from 0x%p to 0x%p",regfile_physaddr, regfile_virtbase);
00541   }
00542   if (regfile_virtbase && msgbuf_in_virtbase && msgbuf_out_virtbase){
00543 
00544     // test the MIB, the MRB is readonly and can not be tested
00545     writel(0x40, regfile_virtbase); // set bit 6 in the control register which enables the MIB to be read/write
00546     iNofErr=memtest((u32) msgbuf_in_virtbase , dcsc_msgbuf_in_size);
00547     if (iNofErr==0) {
00548       //mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "first test succeeded - buffer size = %d errors = %d", dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, iNofErr);
00549       dcs_writevalue((u32)msgbuf_in_virtbase, dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, TEST_PATTERN);
00550       if ((iNofErr=dcs_comparevalue((u32)msgbuf_in_virtbase, dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, TEST_PATTERN))==0) {
00551     writel(0x00, regfile_virtbase); // now set the buffer to write only
00552     iNofErr=dcs_comparevalue((u32)msgbuf_in_virtbase, dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, TEST_PATTERN);
00553 
00554     if (iNofErr==dcsc_msgbuf_in_size) { // the test should fail now
00555       iNofErr=0;
00556     } else {
00557       mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "some of the locations are still read/writeable, but the buffer is supposed to be write only ");
00558       if (iNofErr>0)
00559         iNofErr=0;
00560     }
00561       } else {
00562     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "second test of MIB failed - buffer size = %d errors = %d", dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, iNofErr);
00563       }
00564     } else {
00565       mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "first test of MIB failed - buffer size = %d errors = %d", dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, iNofErr);
00566     }
00567     if (iNofErr>0) {
00568       mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "memtest finished with %d error(s), eventually check your parameters", iNofErr);
00569       iResult=-EIO;
00570     } else {
00571       mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "message buffer found and tested(test pattern 0x%x)", TEST_PATTERN);
00572     }
00573   } else if ((regfile_virtbase==NULL && dcsc_regfile_size>0) ||
00574          (msgbuf_in_virtbase==NULL && dcsc_msgbuf_in_size>0) ||
00575          (msgbuf_out_virtbase==NULL && dcsc_msgbuf_out_size>0) 
00576          ){
00577     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "can not remap hardware resources");
00578     iResult=-EIO;
00579   }
00580   if (iResult<0) {
00581     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "can not initialize memory areas");
00582     cleanupRealBuffers();
00583   }
00584   return iResult;
00585 }
00586 
00587 #else //DCSC_TEST
00588 /*
00589  * cleanup of the buffers for the simulated driver
00590  */
00591 void cleanupSimulatedBuffers(void)
00592 {
00593   if (msgbuf_in_virtbase) kfree(msgbuf_in_virtbase);
00594   if (msgbuf_out_virtbase) kfree(msgbuf_out_virtbase);
00595   if (regfile_virtbase) kfree(regfile_virtbase);
00596 }
00597 
00598 /*
00599  * initialization of the buffers for the simulated driver
00600  */
00601 int initSimulatedBuffers(void)
00602 {
00603   int iResult=0;
00604   int iNofErr=0;
00605   mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "this is a test version");
00606   if (dcsc_msgbuf_in_size>0)
00607     msgbuf_in_virtbase  = (u32*) kmalloc(dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, GFP_KERNEL);
00608   if (dcsc_msgbuf_out_size>0)
00609     msgbuf_out_virtbase = (u32*) kmalloc(dcsc_msgbuf_out_size, GFP_KERNEL);
00610   if (dcsc_regfile_size)
00611     regfile_virtbase    = (u32*) kmalloc(dcsc_regfile_size, GFP_KERNEL);
00612   if (msgbuf_in_virtbase) mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Allocated MIB at 0x%p %d bytes", msgbuf_in_virtbase, dcsc_msgbuf_in_size);
00613   if (msgbuf_out_virtbase) mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Allocated MRB at 0x%p %d bytes", msgbuf_out_virtbase, dcsc_msgbuf_out_size);
00614   if (regfile_virtbase) mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Allocated REG at 0x%p %d bytes", regfile_virtbase, dcsc_regfile_size);
00615   if (msgbuf_in_virtbase){
00616     iNofErr=memtest( (u32) msgbuf_in_virtbase , dcsc_msgbuf_in_size);
00617     dcs_writevalue((u32)msgbuf_in_virtbase , dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, 0);
00618     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Test MIB: %d errors",iNofErr);
00619   } else {
00620     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "Allocation of MIB failed");
00621   }
00622 
00623   if (msgbuf_out_virtbase){
00624     iNofErr=memtest( (u32) msgbuf_out_virtbase , dcsc_msgbuf_out_size);
00625     dcs_writevalue((u32)msgbuf_out_virtbase , dcsc_msgbuf_out_size, 0);
00626     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Test MRB: %d errors",iNofErr);
00627   } else {
00628     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "Allocation of MRB failed");
00629   }
00630 
00631   if (regfile_virtbase){
00632     iNofErr=memtest( (u32) regfile_virtbase , dcsc_regfile_size);
00633     dcs_writevalue((u32)regfile_virtbase , dcsc_regfile_size, 0);
00634     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Test REG: %d errors",iNofErr);
00635   } else {
00636     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "Allocation of REG failed");
00637   }
00638   return iResult;
00639 }
00640 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00641 
00642 /*
00643  * init_module called from the system during insmod command
00644  */
00645 int init_module(void) {
00646   // TODO check for stuff to cleanup in case of error and undesired termination
00647   int iResult=0;
00648 
00649   // originally the driver sizes of the buffers were checked at driver load. This
00650   // has been removed here in order to have a multi-purpose driver which allows
00651   // access to arbitrary 3 buffers.
00652   // The buffer sizes are check in the dcscMsgBufferInterface anyway.
00653 
00654   // register the driver
00655   iResult = register_chrdev(dcsc_majorID, "dcsc", &dcsc_fops);
00656   if (iResult < 0) {
00657     mrlogmessage(LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "module init: can't register driver");
00658   } else {
00659     mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "Module init (compiled "__DATE__", "__TIME__") version %d.%d - %s", DRIVER_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER, DRIVER_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER, RELEASETYPE);
00660     if (dcsc_majorID == 0) { /* dynamic allocation of major number*/
00661       dcsc_majorID = iResult; 
00662       mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "dynamic allocation of major number: %d", dcsc_majorID);
00663     } else {
00664       mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "register dcscard driver at major no. %d", dcsc_majorID);
00665     }
00666 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00667     iResult=initRealBuffers();
00668 #else 
00669     iResult=initSimulatedBuffers();
00670 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00671     InitDriverLock();
00672   }
00673 
00674   return iResult;
00675 }
00676 
00677 /*
00678  * init_module called from the system during rmmod command
00679  */
00680 void cleanup_module(void) { 
00681   mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "Module exit");
00682 
00683 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00684   cleanupRealBuffers();
00685 #else //DCSC_TEST
00686   cleanupSimulatedBuffers();
00687 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00688 
00689   unregister_chrdev(dcsc_majorID, "dcsc");
00690 }
00691 
00692 /******************************************************************************************************
00693  * implementation of driver access methods defined above
00694  */
00695 
00696 static loff_t dcsc_llseek(struct file* filp, loff_t off, int ref)
00697 {
00698   loff_t lPosition=0;
00699   if (filp){
00700     // by now the ref parameter is ignored, seek always from beginning
00701     lPosition=off;
00702     mrlogmessage(LOG_LLSEEK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "llseek: position=%lld, offset=%lld, new position=%lld", filp->f_pos, off, lPosition);
00703   } else {
00704     mrlogmessage(LOG_LLSEEK|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "llseek: invalid file pointer");
00705     lPosition=-EFAULT;
00706   }
00707   if (lPosition>=0) filp->f_pos=lPosition;
00708   return lPosition;
00709 }
00710 
00711 static int dcsc_read(struct file* filp, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos)
00712 {
00713   int iResult=0;
00714   const char* pBufferName="<not specified name>";
00715   u32 lPos=0;
00716   u32 u32Offset=0;
00717   u32 u32Count=0;
00718   u32* pu32Source=NULL;
00719 
00720   if (filp==NULL) {
00721     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: invalid file pointer");
00722     return -EFAULT;
00723   }
00724 
00725   lPos=filp->f_pos;
00726 
00727   if (filp && buf && count>=0 && lPos>=0){
00728     //mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "read: count=%d f_pos=0x%08x", count, lPos);
00729     mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, MR_KERN_DEBUG "read: count=%d f_pos=0x%08x", count, lPos);
00730     if (iAccessMode==ACCESS_ALL) {
00731       if (lPos < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size) {
00732     if (count + lPos <= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size) {
00733       u32Count=count;
00734     } else {
00735       u32Count=dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00736       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "read: read access exceeds size of msg_in buffer, truncate");
00737     }
00738     u32Offset=lPos;
00739     pu32Source=msgbuf_in_virtbase;
00740     pBufferName="write msg buffer";
00741       } else if (lPos >= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size && lPos < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size+dcsc_msgbuf_out_size) {
00742     if (count + lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size <= dcsc_msgbuf_out_size) {
00743       u32Count=count;
00744     } else {
00745       u32Count=dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00746       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "read: read access exceeds size of msg_out buffer, truncate");
00747     }
00748     u32Offset=lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00749     pu32Source=msgbuf_out_virtbase;
00750     pBufferName="read msg buffer";
00751       } else if (lPos >= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size + dcsc_msgbuf_out_size && lPos < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size + dcsc_msgbuf_out_size + dcsc_regfile_size) {
00752     if (count + lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size - dcsc_msgbuf_out_size <= dcsc_regfile_size) {
00753       u32Count=count;
00754     } else {
00755       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "read: read access exceeds size of register buffer, read maximum");
00756       u32Count=dcsc_regfile_size;
00757     }
00758     u32Offset=lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size - dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00759     pu32Source=regfile_virtbase;
00760     pBufferName="register buffer";
00761       }
00762     } else {
00763       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: access mode not yet implemented");
00764     }
00765     if (pu32Source!=NULL) {
00766       // to be deleted u32Offset*=sizeof(size_t);
00767       u32Offset/=sizeof(u32);
00768       pu32Source+=u32Offset;
00769       //mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "read: reading %d byte(s) from %s at 0x%8p to buffer 0x%8p", u32Count, pBufferName, pu32Source, buf);
00770       mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, MR_KERN_DEBUG "read: reading %d byte(s) from %s at 0x%8p to buffer 0x%8p", u32Count, pBufferName, pu32Source, buf);
00771       dcs_read((u32)pu32Source, u32Count, (u32*)buf);
00772       iResult=(int)u32Count;
00773       if (f_pos) *f_pos=filp->f_pos+iResult;
00774       else mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "read: invalid parameter f_pos, skipping position increment");
00775     } else {
00776       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: read access denied");
00777       iResult=-EFAULT;
00778     }
00779   } else {
00780     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: invalid parameter");
00781     iResult=-EINVAL;
00782   }
00783   return iResult;
00784 }
00785 
00786 static int dcsc_write(struct file* filp, const char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos)
00787 {
00788   int iResult=0;
00789   const char* pBufferName="<not specified name>";
00790   u32 lPos=0;
00791   u32 u32Offset=0;
00792   u32 u32Count=0;
00793   u32* pu32Target=NULL;
00794 
00795   if (filp==NULL) {
00796     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: invalid file pointer");
00797     return -EFAULT;
00798   }
00799   lPos=filp->f_pos;
00800   if (filp && buf && count>=0 && lPos>=0){
00801     //mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "write: count=%d f_pos=0x%08x", count, lPos);
00802     mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, MR_KERN_DEBUG "write: count=%d f_pos=0x%08x", count, lPos);
00803     if (iAccessMode==ACCESS_ALL) {
00804       if (lPos < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size) {
00805     if (count + lPos <= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size) {
00806       u32Offset=lPos;
00807       u32Count=count;
00808       pu32Target=msgbuf_in_virtbase;
00809       pBufferName="write msg buffer";
00810     } else {
00811       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "write: write access exceeds size of msg_in buffer");
00812     }
00813       } else if (lPos >= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size && lPos < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size+dcsc_msgbuf_out_size) {
00814     if (count + lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size <= dcsc_msgbuf_out_size) {
00815       u32Offset=lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00816       u32Count=count;
00817       pu32Target=msgbuf_out_virtbase;
00818       pBufferName="read msg buffer";
00819     } else {
00820       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "write: write access exceeds size of msg_out buffer");
00821     }
00822       } else if (lPos >= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size + dcsc_msgbuf_out_size && lPos < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size + dcsc_msgbuf_out_size + dcsc_regfile_size) {
00823     if (count + lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size - dcsc_msgbuf_out_size <= dcsc_regfile_size) {
00824       u32Offset=lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size - dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00825       u32Count=count;
00826       pu32Target=regfile_virtbase;
00827       pBufferName="register buffer";
00828     } else {
00829       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "write: write access exceeds size of register buffer");
00830     }
00831       }
00832     } else {
00833       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: access mode not yet implemented");
00834     }
00835     if (pu32Target!=NULL) {
00836       // to be deleted u32Offset*=sizeof(size_t);
00837       u32Offset/=sizeof(u32);
00838       pu32Target+=u32Offset;
00839       //mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "write: writing %d byte(s) from buffer 0x%8p to %s at 0x%8p", u32Count, (u32*)buf, pBufferName, pu32Target);
00840       mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, MR_KERN_DEBUG "write: writing %d byte(s) from buffer 0x%8p to %s at 0x%8p", u32Count, (u32*)buf, pBufferName, pu32Target);
00841       dcs_write((u32)pu32Target, u32Count, (u32*)buf);
00842       iResult=(int)u32Count;
00843       if (f_pos) *f_pos=filp->f_pos+iResult;
00844       else mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "write: invalid parameter f_pos, skipping position increment");
00845     } else {
00846       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: write access denied");
00847     iResult=-EFAULT;
00848     }
00849   } else {
00850     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: invalid parameter");
00851     iResult=-EINVAL;
00852   }
00853   return iResult;
00854 }
00855 
00856 static int dcsc_open(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp)
00857 {
00858   int iResult=0;
00859   if ((regfile_virtbase==NULL && dcsc_regfile_size>0) ||
00860       (msgbuf_in_virtbase==NULL && dcsc_msgbuf_in_size>0) ||
00861       (msgbuf_out_virtbase==NULL && dcsc_msgbuf_out_size>0) 
00862       ){
00863     mrlogmessage(LOG_OPEN_CLOSE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_CRIT "open: panic, some base addresses not initialized");
00864     iResult=-EFAULT;
00865   } else {
00866     mrlogmessage(LOG_OPEN_CLOSE|LOG_INFO, MR_KERN_DEBUG "open device!");
00867   }
00868   return iResult;
00869 }
00870 
00871 static int dcsc_close(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp)
00872 {
00873   int iResult=0;
00874   mrlogmessage(LOG_OPEN_CLOSE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "close");
00875   return iResult;
00876 }

00878 static int dcsc_mmap(struct file* filp, struct vm_area_struct* vma)
00879 {
00880   int iResult=0;
00881   mrlogmessage(LOG_MMAP|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "mmap: not yet implemented");
00882   return iResult;
00883 }
00884 
00885 static int dcsc_ioctl(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00886 {
00887   int iResult=0;
00888   if (filp==NULL || inode==NULL) {
00889     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "ioctl: invalid file/inode pointer");
00890     return -EFAULT;
00891   }
00892   if (cmd>=IOCTL_READ_REG && cmd<IOCTL_READ_REG+dcsc_regfile_size) {
00893     int iReg=cmd-IOCTL_READ_REG;
00894     iResult=*(((char*)regfile_virtbase)+iReg);
00895     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_DBG, KERN_INFO "ioctl: read register %d = %#x", iReg, iResult);
00896   } else if (cmd>=IOCTL_WRITE_REG && cmd<IOCTL_WRITE_REG+dcsc_regfile_size) {
00897     int iReg=cmd-IOCTL_READ_REG;
00898     if (arg>=256) {
00899       mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_INFO, MR_KERN_DEBUG "ioctl: attempt to write register %d with argument larger than one byte, msbs will be ignored", iReg);
00900       arg&=0xff;
00901     }
00902     *(((char*)regfile_virtbase)+iReg)=arg;
00903   } else switch (cmd) {
00904   case IOCTL_GET_MSGBUF_IN_SIZE:
00905     *((u32*)arg)=dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00906     iResult=dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00907     break;
00908   case IOCTL_GET_MSGBUF_OUT_SIZE:
00909     *((u32*)arg)=dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00910     iResult=dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00911     break;
00912   case IOCTL_GET_REGFILE_SIZE:
00913     *((u32*)arg)=dcsc_regfile_size;
00914     iResult=dcsc_regfile_size;
00915     break;
00916   case IOCTL_GET_VERSION_V02:
00917   case IOCTL_GET_VERSION:
00918     {
00919       if (arg!=0) {
00920     char versionstring[VERSION_STRING_SIZE];
00921     int iLen=snprintf(versionstring, sizeof(versionstring), "%d.%d - %s", DRIVER_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER, DRIVER_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER, RELEASETYPE);
00922     int iRet = 0;
00923     if (iLen>0) {
00924       iRet = copy_to_user((void*)arg, versionstring, iLen);
00925     } else {
00926       iRet = copy_to_user((void*)arg, "", 1);
00927     }
00928       }
00929       iResult=(DRIVER_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER << 16) + DRIVER_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER;
00930     }
00931     break;
00932   case IOCTL_GET_VERS_STR_SIZE:
00933     iResult=VERSION_STRING_SIZE;
00934     break;
00935   case IOCTL_SET_DEBUG_LEVEL:
00936     if (arg>0xffff)
00937       mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "ioctl: log flags are 16 bit wide, skip MSBs of argument");
00938     arg&=0xffff;
00939     g_logflags=arg;
00940     break;
00941   case IOCTL_SET_LOG_FILE:
00942     if (arg>0) {
00943       if (strlen((char*)arg)<sizeof(g_logfilename)-1) {
00944     sprintf(g_logfilename, (char*)arg);
00945     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "ioctl (0x%x): set logfile name to \'%s\'", cmd, g_logfilename);
00946       } else {
00947     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "iotcl (0x%x): file name to long, maximum name length %d", cmd, sizeof(g_logfilename));
00948     iResult=-EINVAL;
00949       }
00950     } else {
00951       mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "iotcl (0x%x): invalid argument", cmd);
00952       iResult=-EINVAL;
00953     }
00954     break;
00955   case IOCTL_LOCK_DRIVER:
00956     iResult=lockDriver(arg, 0);
00957     break;
00958   case IOCTL_UNLOCK_DRIVER:
00959     //iResult=unlockDriver(arg);
00960     iResult=unlockDriver();
00961     break;
00962   case IOCTL_SEIZE_DRIVER:
00963     iResult=seizeDriver(arg);
00964     break;
00965   case IOCTL_RELEASE_DRIVER:
00966     iResult=releaseDriver(arg);
00967     break;
00968   case IOCTL_RESET_LOCK:
00969     iResult=lockReset();
00970     break;
00971   case IOCTL_ACTIVATE_LOCK:
00972     iResult=lockActivate();
00973     break;
00974   case IOCTL_TEST_MSGBUF_IN:
00975   case IOCTL_TEST_MSGBUF_OUT:
00976     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "ioctl: command not implemented");
00977     iResult=-ENOSYS;
00978     break;
00979   default:
00980     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "ioctl: unknown command 0x%x", cmd);
00981   }
00982   return iResult;
00983 }

Generated on 12 Nov 2013 for RCU linux tools and drivers for the DCS board by  1.4.7
